answerText: diamagnetism[10] The super form of diamagnetism is this effect, which was first described by the London equations. It occurs at very low temperatures and results in the expulsion of nearly all external magnetic fields. A magnet can be made to float above a superconductor via this effect.

subject: Science
question: Question: Materials that display this phenomenon have magnetic permeabilities less than the vacuum permeability. For 10 points each: [10] Name this phenomenon that occurs when an external magnetic field induces magnetic dipoles to generate a field opposite from the external field.
